en.stage1Task2: Find the employee badge and a digital device to reply with.
en.stage1Task3: Use both collected items on the bridge console.
en.stage1Task4: Locate an analog clock somewhere around the bridge.
en.stage1Reminder1: Technologies make it possible to receive and decode digitized information.
en.stage1Reminder2: Digital signals are either on or off.
en.stage1Reminder3: Digital information can maintain quality over a long-distance transmission, as opposed to analog signals.
en.stage1IntroText1: Greetings robot 486. Welcome to Communication Space Station 80.
en.stage1IntroText2: Here we analyze, decrypt, and respond to digital and analog signals, received from throughout the galaxy.
en.stage1IntroText3: Your job is to decode the signals and reply where you can.
en.stage1IntroText4: Looks like work has already started. There is a message waiting on the ship's console.
en.stage1IntroText5: You can walk over there with WASD or the arrow keys. If you want to interact with the world, you can use the left mouse button on the touchpad or mouse.
en.stage1IntroText6: Excellent work! Before we check out the incoming message. Let's talk about digital and analog signals.
en.stage1IntroText7: A digital signal is a signal that represents data as a sequence of discrete values.
en.stage1IntroText8: An analog signal is a voltage, current, or physical quantity that continuously and infinitely varies in accordance with a time-varying parameter.
en.stage1IntroText9: The major difference between both signals is that analog signals have continuous electrical signals, while digital signals have non-continuous electrical signals.
en.stage1IntroText10: 2 important things to know about digital signals.
en.stage1IntroText10a: 1: Technologies make it possible to receive and decode digitized information. 2: Digital signals are either on or off.
en.stage1IntroText11: Some examples of technologies that use digital signals are cell phones, smartwatches, and even the average PC keyboard.
en.stage1IntroText12: Some examples of analog signals are radio waves, television waves, sound waves and the average wall clock.
en.stage1IntroText13: Looks like the message we received is encrypted and needs an employee badge to decode. We need to find one somewhere in this room.
en.stage1IntroText14: Also, can you find a piece of digital technology that will allow us to type a reply?
en.stage1IntroText15: Can you find both of these items now? To pick up an item, simply click it with the left mouse button on the touchpad or mouse.
en.stage1IntroText16: Excellent this keyboard is digital and just what we need.
en.stage1IntroText17: No, this old TV is an analog device, we need a digital device that will allow to type a reply. Try again.
en.stage1IntroText18: There is nothing in this locker. Try another!
en.stage1IntroText19: Excellent you have found an employee badge.
en.stage1IntroText20: Now we have both items, let's use them on the console.
en.stage1IntroText21: You can open your inventory with the button on the screen and you can take an item out of the inventory by clicking it with the left mouse button.
en.stage1IntroText22: To use a held object, simply move the mouse over the thing you want to use it on and click the left mouse button, on the mouse or touchpad.
en.stage1IntroText23: Did you know that digital information can maintain quality over a long-distance transmission, as opposed to analog signals.
en.stage1IntroText23a: Excellent work! A long range, digital message is coming through on the screen. Can you find the message on screen?
en.stage1IntroText24: Hello Space Station 80. I have messaged to inform you that I left you some digital devices in the crews quarters, just in the next room. Have a look.
en.stage1IntroText25: This message has come from 200 light years away. We can respond with a digital signal or an analog signal.
en.stage1IntroText25a: Remember that we need to transmit this message over a long distance, so we need to send the correct type of signal.
en.stage1IntroText25b: Can you search the console and look for the correct method of response?
en.stage1IntroText26: Thank you. I’ll check them out when I next get a break.
en.stage1IntroText27: Devices? Awesome! I hope one of them is the R-Pad 9000!
en.stage1IntroText28: I'll have a look soon. I'm really busy. Thanks though!
en.stage1IntroText29: Before we go check out the new devices. We need to find out if it’s break time.
en.stage1IntroText30: Somewhere around the bridge is an analog clock. Can you find it please and get the time?
en.stage1IntroText31: This is a clock but it's digital. Try again!
en.stage1IntroText32: Excellent this wall mounted clock is an analog device. And it’s time for our break! Let's head to the door and explore the crew quarters.
en.stage1IncorrectSpeakerItem: This clock is digital but it won’t help us reply to the message on the console. Try again!
en.stage1IncorrectClockItem: These are analog speakers and won’t help us reply to the message. Try again!
en.stage2IntroText1: It's so dark in here, how will we find the devices that Robot 80 left us?
en.stage2IntroText2: We need to turn on the light. Light switches also come in digital and analog forms.
en.stage2IntroText3: Can you search the room for a digital light switch? We can use the torch in your inventory.
en.stage2IntroText4: Excellent. This light switch is digital. How strange, the light didn't turn on. Can you find an analog light switch, please?
en.stage2IntroText5: Oh, fantastic. The lights are on. Let's search for those devices.
en.stage2IntroText6: It is important to know, that modern technologies use digitized signals as a reliable way to encode and transmit information.
en.stage2IntroText7: Can you find 3 modern digital devices around the crew quarters?
en.stage2IntroText11: That's all 3 devices. Oh, there is a message on the smartwatch. Let’s take a closer look!
en.stage2IntroText12: Did you know that Information can be stored on various types of devices?
en.stage2IntroText13WatchMessage1: Hey dude. There is a new security system stopping you from getting into the communication deck.
en.stage2IntroText14WatchMessage2: I left the code somewhere on this device. You will need to have a look through its files and find it.
en.stage2IntroText15: Thanks dude  I'll have a look now!
en.stage2IntroText16: Oh great, more security! Thanks for the code.
en.stage2IntroText17: Thank you. I hope it's easier to remember than the last one.
en.stage2IntroText18: Let's enter the code and check out the communication deck.
en.stage2IntroText19DoorCorrect: That’s the correct code, the door is unlocked.
en.stage2IntroText20: Oh, that code didn’t work. Let’s check out the smartwatch again and see if we remembered it wrong.
